dt: {bc}a painful spasmodic condition of muscles (as of the neck or back)

shortdef: a painful spasmodic condition of muscles (as of the neck or back)

dt: {bc}to turn or twist (something, such as one's head) especially into a strained position

shortdef: to turn or twist (something, such as one's head) especially into a strained position

dt.t: I grew up fishing on little {wi}cricks{/wi} with my dad.

et: variant of {et_link|creek:|creek}, probably by shortening of Middle English {it}crike{/it}

dt: {bc}of or relating to the Watson-Crick model

shortdef: of or relating to the Watson-Crick model

dt: {bc}a model of DNA structure in which the molecule is a cross-linked double-stranded helix, each strand is composed of alternating links of phosphate and deoxyribose, and the strands are cross-linked by pairs of purine and pyrimidine bases projecting inward from the deoxyribose sugars and joined by hydrogen bonds with adenine paired with thymine and with cytosine paired with guanine {dx}compare {dxt|double helix||}{/dx}

shortdef: a model of DNA structure in which the molecule is a cross-linked double-stranded helix, each strand is composed of alternating links of phosphate and deoxyribose, and the strands are cross-linked by pairs of purine and pyrimidine bases projecting inward from the deoxyribose sugars and joined by hydrogen bonds with adenine paired with thymine and with cytosine paired with guanine
